methodspecific.title: method specific
methodspecific.description: the method specific section incorporates the all neccessary metadata for each measurement methods.

scanning electron microscopy.description: the scanning electron microscopy subsection describes all specific sem-metadata which are adjustable in each sem device.

accelerating voltage.description: the accelerating voltage describes the voltage in [kv] at the cathode which generates the electric accelerating field.

decelerating voltage.description: the deccelerating voltage describes a negative voltage in [kv] which can be applied at the tool's stage, to deccelerate the beam before it hits the specimen for a lower landing voltage.

working distance.description: the working distance, is defined as the distance in [mm] between the objective lens and the focal plane or the final crossover point of the beam.

magnification.description: the magnification value indicates the magnification of the raster field.

signal type(s).description: the type of signal which was detected to generate the image.

detector.description: the type of detector used by the tool to collect the electron signal.

mixed signals.description: indicates the detected signals which were mixed to generate the image. is left ommited if only one signal is used.

signal proportion.description: describes the proportion of the used signals in [%]

aperture alignment x, y.description: the relatve centering of the aperture in x and y direction in the electron beam path in [%]. the first entry denotes the x-proportion and the second the y-proportion.

stigmator alignment x, y.description: the relative alignment of the magnetic field in the objective lens to form or shift the elctronic beam in x and y direction in [%]. the first entry denotes the x-proportion and the second the y-proportion.

brightness.description: the relative brightness of the image in [%]. a value of 100% corresponds to a white image and 0% to a black image.

contrast.description: the relative contrast of the image in [%]. higher values correspond to a high contrast.

emission current.description: the value indicates the emitted current out of the electron gun in [ua].

probe current.description: the value indicates the current which hits the specimen in [ua]
